entry.title: Bernstein: Top US general compared Trump to 'Hitlerian fascism'

media:group.media:title: Bernstein: Top US general compared Trump to 'Hitlerian fascism'
media:group.media:description:
During a discussion about excerpts from "I Alone Can Fix It" by Washington Post reporters Carol Leonnig and Philip Rucker, CNN's Carl Bernstein points out that the Chairman of the Joints Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley compared former President Donald Trump's behavior to Adolph Hitler and Nazi-style fascism.
#CarlBernstein #CNN #NewDay

entry.title: City center left gutted after violence and looting in South Africa

media:group.media:title: City center left gutted after violence and looting in South Africa
media:group.media:description:
CNN's David McKenzie reports from Soweto, South Africa, on the devastating aftereffects of looting and protests that took place in parts of the country. Protests erupted last week as former South African President Jacob Zuma, 79, turned himself in to authorities to serve a 15-month jail term for contempt of court. At least 72 have died in some of the worst violence the country has seen in years.
#David McKenzie #CNNInternational #Newsroom

entry.title: 'You f**king did this': Cheney rips Jim Jordan after Capitol riot in new book

media:group.media:title: 'You f**king did this': Cheney rips Jim Jordan after Capitol riot in new book
media:group.media:description: A new book titled 'I Alone Can Fix It' from Washington Post reporters Carol Leonnig and Philip Rucker details a phone call between Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) and Gen. Mark Milley the day after the Capitol insurrection, in which Cheney told Milley what she experienced on the House floor on January 6, including a run-in with Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), a staunch Trump ally in the House who feverishly tried to overturn the election. #NewDay #JamieGangel #News

entry.title: Trump’s final days in office were even worse than we thought

media:group.media:title: Trump’s final days in office were even worse than we thought
media:group.media:description:
New books about the former president’s last days in office reveal some shocking revelations… even for Trump. In the latest episode of The Point, CNN’s Chris Cillizza talks about what these bombshell excerpts show about the chaos that ended the tumultuous tenure of Trump.
SOURCES AND FURTHER READING:
Smell the Glove by Spinal Tap https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rOSAumt6YF4
https://www.amazon.com/Frankly-Did-Win-This-Election/dp/153873480X
https://www.amazon.com/Landslide-Final-Days-Trump-Presidency/dp/125083001X/ref=pd_lpo_1?pd_rd_i=125083001X&psc=1
https://www.amazon.com/Alone-Can-Fix-Donald-Catastrophic-ebook/dp/B095BZ463N/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=leonnig+and+rucker&qid=1626193284&s=books&sr=1-1
Austin Powers - Carnies https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZXRfnIfFYFI
Trump said whoever 'leaked' info on his White House bunker stay should be 'executed,' new book claims https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/13/politics/trump-white-house-bunker-leak-executed-treason-book-claims/index.html
‘I Alone Can Fix It’ book excerpt: Inside Trump’s Election Day and the birth of the ‘big lie’ https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/07/13/book-excerpt-i-alone-can-fix-it/
Trump's Situation Room shouting match https://www.axios.com/trump-mark-milley-protests-michael-bender-a41db287-7f6a-43d9-9a4c-1ba7a0307881.html
About me: I was named "best dressed" in 7th grade. That, along with being CNN's editor at large and author of the daily "Point" newsletter are my proudest achievements. Look for me here every Tuesday and Thursday to find out what’s really going down in politics.
CREDITS Writer: Chris Cillizza Producer: Moira Donohue The Point Editor: Leigh Munsil Video Editor: Wes Latta
Follow Chris on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cillizzac/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/cillizzacnn Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/chris.cillizza/

#CNN #Cillizza #Trump

entry.title: Video shows 22 Afghan commandos executed by the Taliban

media:group.media:title: Video shows 22 Afghan commandos executed by the Taliban
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Anna Coren reports from Kabul, Afghanistan, with new evidence of atrocities committed by the Taliban. Video has emerged of Afghan commandos being shot dead after an apparent surrender. The Taliban rejects the video, saying it is fabricated.
This is an updated version of previously uploaded video. #AnnaCoren #CNNInternational

entry.title: New book shows top US generals planned ways to stop Trump in case of coup

media:group.media:title: New book shows top US generals planned ways to stop Trump in case of coup
media:group.media:description: The top US military officer, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs Gen. Mark Milley, was so shaken that then-President Donald Trump and his allies might attempt a coup or take other dangerous or illegal measures after the November election that Milley and other top officials informally planned for different ways to stop Trump, according to excerpts of an upcoming book obtained by CNN. CNN’s Anderson Cooper and Jamie Gangel discuss. #CNN #News

entry.title: ‘Inflation is a real concern’: Bernie Sanders on spending plan

media:group.media:title: ‘Inflation is a real concern’: Bernie Sanders on spending plan
media:group.media:description: President Joe Biden told Senate Democrats “we’re going to get this done” as lawmakers reached a deal on a $3.5 trillion spending plan. CNN’s Wolf Blitzer and Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) discuss. #CNN #News

entry.title: Guest challenges Fox News host to tell viewers Trump lost

media:group.media:title: Guest challenges Fox News host to tell viewers Trump lost
media:group.media:description:
Democratic Texas state Rep. James Talarico, who left the state in an effort to block Republicans from passing a restrictive voting law, challenged Fox News host Pete Hegseth to tell his viewers that former President Donald Trump lost the 2020 election.
#Newsroom #VictorBlackwell #CNN

entry.title: CNN series tells the story of Jerusalem, one of the most controversial cities in history

media:group.media:title: CNN series tells the story of Jerusalem, one of the most controversial cities in history
media:group.media:description:
CNN hosted an advance screening of the premiere episode of the new CNN Original Series, Jerusalem: City of Faith and Fury, on Tuesday, July 13 @ 8 PM ET. This exclusive preview was followed by a conversation about the episode moderated by CNN Pentagon Correspondent Oren Liebermann. The panelists included: Michael Brenner, Seymour and Lillian AbensohnChair in Israel Studies at American University in Washington DC Suleiman A. Mourad, Professor, Smith College
#CNNOriginalSeries #News #JerusalemCityofFaithandFury

entry.title: Economist explains why there are so many job openings

media:group.media:title: Economist explains why there are so many job openings
media:group.media:description:
Wages are going up as companies struggle to fill open jobs. Nela Richardson, Chief Economist at ADP Research Institute, explains to CNN Business's Alison Kosik why these increases might not be enough to attract new hires.
This interview is from our show "Markets Now". Watch the live digital show every Wednesday 12:45 p.m. to 1 p.m. ET., and get the latest news on the most important investing stories of the day as they happen: https://cnn.it/2ygGXfO
#CNN #Business #Jobs

entry.title: SE Cupp: Don't dismiss Richard Branson's accomplishment in space

media:group.media:title: SE Cupp: Don't dismiss Richard Branson's accomplishment in space
media:group.media:description: CNN's SE Cupp says reporters shouldn't be called out for expressing emotion over Richard Branson's flight to space. #CNN #News

entry.title: Video shows wild chase following assassination of Haiti's President

media:group.media:title: Video shows wild chase following assassination of Haiti's President
media:group.media:description:
The plot to kill Haiti's President allegedly spanned multiple countries and involved highly experienced former military officers and months of planning, according to local officials. Yet the primary suspects in the case appear to have been unprepared for their fierce pursuit by Haitian security forces. CNN has obtained exclusive information about the hunt for the killers of Jovenel Moise, a banana exporter-turned-politician who was killed in a hail of gunfire in the bedroom of his private residence in the leafy Port-au-Prince district of Petion-Ville at around 1 a.m. last Wednesday, according to government statements. The Haitian President's body was found riddled with bullet holes, according to a local official tasked with documenting the crime scene, who also said Moise had suffered a broken leg and serious facial injuries. Multiple government officials described the injuries to CNN as signs of torture. Moise's wife, Martine, was wounded. She is being treated in a Miami hospital. "In the blink of an eye, the mercenaries ran into my house and killed my husband," Haiti's first lady said in an audio recording released over the weekend. CNN cannot independently confirm the authenticity of the recording. But despite the abundance of bullet holes documented inside the President's home, not one member of the President's security detail or residential staff was hurt, according to authorities. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.
#MattRivers #CNN #News

entry.title: Biden bucks progressives and calls for more police funding

media:group.media:title: Biden bucks progressives and calls for more police funding
media:group.media:description:
President Joe Biden announced that he wants to provide more funds to hire police officers, putting him at odds with the progressive wing of his own party who wants to defund police departments across the country.
#ErinBurnett #ErinBurnettOutFront #CNN

entry.title: 'History of the Sitcom' explores the evolution of TV comedies

media:group.media:title: 'History of the Sitcom' explores the evolution of TV comedies
media:group.media:description: CNN Original Series premiered the first episode of the new series, “History of the Sitcom” at a virtual screening event. A panel discussion followed and featured: Bill Carter, Executive Producer, “History of the Sitcom” Lorraine Ali, Television and Culture Critic, Los Angeles Times Patrick Gomez, Executive Editor, Entertainment Weekly #HistoryofSitcom #CNNOriginalSeries #CNN
